com.absynth.battleship.data

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absynth.battleship.data.Cell

  • class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a cell in the BattleShipBoard.
    A Cell can contain a one single object at a time, and such objects can only be described Cell.Content.
    Once a cell is set to a coordinate of the battlechip board, through its constructor, it cannot be changed.

    Note: That the cell does not care what coords it contains, it is up to the caller to make sure it is valid Coord.
    Author:
    David Boivin (Absynth)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(Coord coords)
        Default constructor, which takes only the absolute necessary information, the coordinates of the cell. The other fields are set to their defaults, content to Content.NOTHING and owner to null.
        Parameters:
        coords - The coordinates of the cell.

      • Cell

        public Cell(Coord coords,
            Cell.Content content,
            java.lang.String owner)
        Constructor which initializes all the fields by calling the default constructor with the given coordinates, but also modifies the other fields based on what the user has entered in the parameters. Useful when the owner and content are already known.
        Parameters:
        coords - The coordinates of the cell.
        content - The content of the cell.
        owner - The owner of the cell.

    • Method Detail

      • getCoords

        public Coord getCoords()
        Gets the coordinates of the cell.

      • getContent

        public Cell.Content getContent()
        Gets the content of the cell.

      • getOwner

        public java.lang.String getOwner()
        Gets the Owner of the cell.

      • setHide

        public void setHide(boolean b)
        Sets whether the next call to toString() will display this cell or "hide" it's content.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the content should be hidden and false if it is ton be displayed.

      • setContent

        public void setContent(java.lang.String o,
                       Cell.Content c)
        Method used to set the content. The content must have an associated owner. If the owner of is null then the cell belongs to the board.
        Parameters:
        o - The owner of this cell and it's content.
        c - The content of this cell.

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Returns whether on next call, the toString() method will hide the content of this cell.
        Returns:
        true if this cell will be hidden and false if it is to b displayed.

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied()
        Returns whether there is content in this cell or not.
        Returns:
        true if there the content is not Content.NOTHING and false if there is anything inside the cell.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the display of this cell. This method checks if the hide flag is on and if it is, returns the HIDE_CHARACTER, other wise it returns the content of the cell, represented by SHIP_CHARACTER and GRENADE_CHARACTER or the HIT_CHARACTER if the cell is empty.

        Note: The output is not formatted based on owner, that is up to the called to implement if they wish.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
